data.title: Weekend lunch
data.text: Great finger sandwiches along with pot of tea. Good choices of tea flavors and the varied China dishes bring back nostalgic memories.  Family run business

data.title: Cute Place
data.text: This is a cute place for a light 'ladies' lunch.  Sandwich samplers and tea are their specialties.  Located in the older section of Pearland.

data.title: Such a fun little place and wonderful food!
data.text: Our tween loves tea so we saw this on TA and of course we had to come! We loved the setting in a very quaint little house with tea pots and cups everywhere.  The food was excellent.  My husband said he would come back for the chicken salad alone.  The service was great too.  We met the owner and each waitress was always checking to make sure we had everything we needed.  Definitely will come back!

data.title: Great Little Texas Tea Room in Pearland
data.text: I enjoyed the Tearoom sampler; 3 finger sandwiches (gluten free option available); and two sides (fruit cup, soup  or pasta salad). I tried tomato basil and bite of my friends broccoli cheese soup. It was very good. Wonderful peach tea (not too sweet, just right) and special recipe spiced hot tea was excellent. White chocolate bread pudding and lemon bar were so yummy!  The room was quite full by noon time. The hostesses were very gracious. Mostly women but one "smart" older gent was there to grab a bite.  I booked this place for my daughter's baby shower. It's perfect for ladies groups or even a spot of tea and dessert.

data.title: Fun for ladies
data.text: I have been to this place several times and always take my girlfriends when they come from out of town.  It is just a fun and unique place to go.  The food is delicious and the atmosphere is very southern.

data.title: Canned chicken salad spread
data.text: ordered chicken salad finger sandwich. It didn't taste right. Kinda like tuna. I asked if this was tuna and was told no. It was chicken spread. WHAT? tasted like it was canned. Then I was told that they do have chicken salad with added fruit, etc. Would I lake for one to be brought out me and my guest, which they did. That tasted like chicken salad not that canned chicken spread crap. When I go to a tea room I expect fresh chicken salad. Both my guest was both charged a $1 more for the privileged of getting what we had expected all alone in the replacement finger sandwich. WILL NOT GO BACK   I live locally and will tell others my experience.

data.title: Cute, Cute, Cute!
data.text: Cute little house - just what a tea room should be like!  Ate on the porch (nice) and we had the sampler with pimento cheese, chicken salad and cucumber sandwiches.  Excellent!  You start out with a cup of their spice tea which is delicious.  They have various teas (hot or cold) which you can get by the teapot or cup.  We  had their pumpkin bread for desert which is the best I have ever had!  The only complaint is that we stood in the doorway for awhile to get seated.  We went early so they weren't busy at the time.  But besides that we will be back!

data.title: Very cute spot
data.text: We love this place for a girls lunch.  They have delicious finger sandwiches and tea!  The pumpkin sandwich (more like a dessert) is to die for!

data.title: Excellent Tea Party with Anna and Elsa
data.text:
I had the opportunity to take a young friend to the Tea Room this weekend to have a tea party with her favorite Disney princesses Anna and Elsa from the movie "Frozen".  It was so much fun.  The Tea Room took reservations and was so organized about getting everyone seated and making them feel at home.

The tea was served in courses and each course was brought out in a timely manner with the best customer service.  Additionally the food was excellent!!  The broccoli cheese soup was perfection and the pumpkin spice dessert was heavenly.  I also loved the chicken salad and pimento cheese.  There was nothing at all wrong with the evening even with the number of young girls in attendance.

I can't wait to go back and experience the restaurant on its own.

The one thing I would warn patrons about is the limited parking.  I was fortunate that I arrived early and it wasn't a real problem, but had I arrived much later, I can see where it would be.
